I was confused by her anger at that moment and didn't understand the tone, nor her demeanor as she was clearly frustrated and actually ANGRY with me and slammed her pad and things down on our table and sighed heavily. She was VERY SLOW and we felt it deliberate, she sure wasn't busy. Only one or two other customers in there at the time. When she would come to the table she would motion with her hands to my daughter (who was kindly stacking plates in order to assist her), to hurry up!!!  We were offered no dessert. When we asked for boxes it took forever and she was just standing there thinking she was out of sight but we were watching her do nothing. We asked her for the check, this also took a long long time, we waited for her to pick the check up, and she was still doing nothing.  once again, deliberate. My daughter, had cash and paid the $51.00 tab for lunch on HER BIRTHDAY just so we could get out of there!!! We left an undeserved tip of $3.14. I reimbursed my daughter but fully intend to visit the manager there and have my money fully refunded - and in addition, the $3.14 can come out of her check. She gets nothing, but fired (if I have anything to say about it). I have been in the food & beverage industry my entire life and have NEVER experienced such BAD service experience. Food was OK, but She left a 'bad taste" in our mouths, and clearly has NO business dealing with the public.

As a person that eats Sushi regularly and has done numerous reviews on sushi restaurants I have to give this place a 3.  The main reason anyone goes to a sushi place is for the fish. The simple and unfortunate fact is that the fish was not cold and it was just mediocre. While service was very good and everything was super clean, I didn't leave feeling I got a good amount for the price.  For instance the tuna sashimi was room temperature and tasted a little metallic for $14.  We such a wide selection of sushi choices this is not a place I plan on returning.

Another one of my favorite spots since moving to the area. I actually have a memory of meeting a friend there for happy hour years ago and really liking it a lot. We recently went for late night happy hour and had a really great time. Whilst having one too many sake bombs, the place had a very good vibe and the bar tender was very attentive to us, not to mention the sushi was delicious. We'll definitely be back, and soon!

Wife and I had a really nice time here a few Saturday's ago. Went kinda late but there was still a few people enjoying food and drinks. I see some people had issues with the service but for us it was fantastic. We actually sat at the bar and only really interacted with the bartender. I believe his name was Jason and he was great. We had no idea what to get but luckily he walked us through the menu and recommended some things that we ended up ordering and everything was very good. The fish was super fresh and the rolls were delicious (can't remember exactly what we had). The atmosphere was really cool and it's great we have a couple places like this now in north east Mesa to eat and have a couple drinks.

This place is great for sushi, lots of room not to cramped  and yes they have a live band , it's a good place to go for good food the right price and fun time out with friends.  The people who are  giving it 1 star are just plain stuck up. This place  is great.

If the food is good enough, I can easily get over bad service. The food came quickly however the waitress was a bit rude and was talking on the phone when serving me. Whatever. Let's move on to the food. unfortunately I learned the hard way that sometimes you need to listen to yelp reviews! This was by far the worst sushi I have ever eaten. I ordered the sushi lunch special with a spicy tuna handroll. Thank God for that hand roll (which was decent) because I had to force myself to even finish have the sushi. The fish smelled, felt, and tasted off. As soon as I took my first bite I could taste this very fishy old taste. Really unpleasant. I hope I don't get sick in the near future :(

We have been ordering takeout every weekend but finally went in for dinner. What a pleasant surprise. LOVE this place. The food is outstanding and the people are great. Definitely a new place to go for us!!!!
Very good sushi and a 3.00 kiltlifter on a Saturday!  Sushi was great and we had a Korean dish with bugodi (sp?) sauce and it was wonderful.  We just moved to the area and will be back for sure!

I went years ago and wasn't impressed. A co-worker wanted to meet up for some sushi and picked this place - I was seriously hesitant. This place has improved SO much! Their sushi rolls  and sashimi are some of the best I have had around the valley. The service has always been great and they have a wonderful drink selection and happy hour pricing. My only request - watch out for the salt in the miso and watery salad is a bummer.
On a Saturday night we waited 15 mins and sat down which is not bad at all!  I loved the specialty sushi they have but sushi and service was great all-in-all!

My search for good sushi is over!  It also comes with great service.   fresh, huge portions, and for half the price of those awful places we kept trying until we wound up here!  The Sushi Chef Sony  not only took great care of us, he gave my 10 year old mochi, without her ordering, How did he know she loved Mochi? we had never been here. We will be back, I can't even begin to  tell you that fresh sushi on a Tuesday before 4pm.  was on my mind,  I walked in saying "I am hoping for the best ,but expecting the worst! AMEN! I am not crazy good sushi good portions and good service do exist. right here in Mesa! Thanks Sony, and Song. We are happy campers, and look forward to seeing you soon!
Food was fantastic - loved the jalapeno poppers, wow. We didn't have one bad meal among the four of us and the service was great.

This place gets a 3 star review because I thought my cucumber salad was way too sweet.  It tasted like it had sugar all over it.  I do like the atomophere and the menu has expanded a lot to include Chinese and Korean food as well.  The food is ok  and Id say the service is a little slow but they are definitely friendly, just seem to forget about you after you get your food.
Nacho Mama and the lettuce wrap was INCREDIBLE! House Cab was a great deal also. The Shogun lettuce wraps are my favorite. Also, my kids love the orange chicken! (Ask for the cheater chopsticks)

Found this place through a Yelp search when I got hungry. And it was a great find.   The sushi rolls were a good size, fresh, and came out fast.  The house wine was inexpensive and good.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere is comfortable and inviting.  I only wish it was closer to where I live, because it would be a regular spot for me.    I was most impressed with the size of the sushi rolls. They seemed to be 25% larger than most places make.  I can't remember the names of the ones I had, but I would definitely buy any of them again.

NOW I know why this place was getting bad reviews. Actually I am still not sure because I got great service the first 4 or 5 times I went there and now saw a new owner sign up about a month ago and decided to go there again after being told a 45 minute wait across the street and Zushi was dead and I know why after this experience. They had one waitress on the floor and it took a long time to get her to come over. Ordered and told her no on the soup and she said it was free and still brought it, VERY DISGUSTING!!! Then a large table came in about the time the guy finished making our sushi and she went over and took the other tables order about 15 minutes and they guy didn't bring our food over, the waitress did after 20 minutes after it was rolled. It wasn't even rolled very tight, kept falling apart. I will NEVER GO BACK AGAIN, Unfortunately.  I liked the atmosphere, but seems like the quality of food and service has went down hill.

This place was a great find! New to the NE area of Mesa we were looking for a local sushi spot. It's dangerous that we're as close to this one as we are! An amazing selection of rolls, great prices and surprisingly large servings! Add to the even better happy hour deals and you've guaranteed you'll see me again!

Yup poor service converted the rating to a 1 star. No Lauren wasn't good, waited 20 minutes at the bar and made eye contact twice wasn't asked for what I would like to drink at all.   Eventually my kind neighbor got up and called out her name and then she asked me what I wanted. No apology, nothing.  Walked out without ordering anything. Thanks for spoiling my weekend Jenny and ensuring that I never come back.

We've been going to zushi for several years and our visit tonight was the worst.  The beef in the fried rice, bulgogi and short ribs was so tough and  full of fat and gristle it was inedible.   The bulgogi beef tasted like the meat was turning rancid.  The condition of the restaurant has suffered too.  The booth fabric is so worn that sitting on the seats is painful in shorts due to cracking of the vinyl.  Our waiter said, as he brought the bill, "Doing anything about your food is beyond my power but here is some mochi."  Really? Sad to say but this is our last time eating here.
Sushi is average but the atmosphere and attitude shine.  We eat here often.  Outstanding happy hour.
I come here occasionally and each time I do I wonder why I don't come here more often. The service is great and the food is as well. Very satisfied. The sushi is super good.

Stay away!!! This was the worst teppanyaki experience of my life.  The chef was super rude, not friendly and funny that I've experienced in other places.  There weren't any sauces served with meal, the wait staff was horribly unprofessional.  Food was barely edible on top of all this.  Do not become unfortunate victims of wasted time and money like we did.

4 stars for the Chinese food! Wow that was delicious! I was very hesitant to go back to Zushi again, but you can't beat the location. I figured we'd try it and if it tasted bad, I'd order the wonton soup. There was no need to order anything else because it was so good.  I am not a fan of the sushi (as posted in my last review), but the Chinese food is on point! We had the szechuan shrimp, the shrimp fried rice, and combination rice. So freaking good! I've been craving Chinese since I left Ca and was looking for somewhere close and tasty and I've found the perfect spot. A bit pricey, which is why the 4 stars instead of 5. Combination rice was $16.50 and shrimp fried rice was $15.50 which is crazy high, but I'm still happily stuffed, so I can't complain too much. We'll be back.
